item.title: Inside Big Pharma's Campaign To Put Us All To Sleep.
item.description:
Inside Big Pharma's Campaign To Put Us All To Sleep.

One evening in the late summer of 2015, Lisa Schwartz was watching television at her Vermont home when an ad for a sleeping pill called Belsomra appeared on the screen.

item.title: Colorado's latest pot recalls: Sticky Buds, Northern Lights Cannabis Co.
item.description:
Colorado's latest pot recalls: Sticky Buds, Northern Lights Cannabis Co.

Colorado cannabis regulators on Friday issued their 15th and 16th marijuana recalls in six weeks -- placing on hold recreational and medical cannabis grown by two Sticky Buds locations and one former Sticky Buds location now owned by Northern Lights Cannabis Co., over concerns the plants were grown with unapproved pesticides.

item.title: 'You even stop thinking of your own family': meet the Isis fighters addicted to amphetamine | Coffee House
item.description:
'You even stop thinking of your own family': meet the Isis fighters addicted to amphetamine | Coffee House

'We would fight them, slaughter them,' Aadheen told me. 'The moment we take a pill we would stop thinking about anything.' The pill he's referring to is Captagon, an amphetamine that's said to fuel some of the brutality associated with Isis. In November last year, Turkish authorities seized 11 million Captagon pills on the Syrian border.

item.title: High Times Wants to Be the Playboy of Pot
item.description:
High Times Wants to Be the Playboy of Pot

In that light, the timing seems right for an underground publication once devoted to guerrilla-style cannabis advocacy to meet mainstream America head-on. "We played defense for 40 years," said Eleanora Kennedy, the widow of High Times's former chairman, who maintains a significant interest in the company. "Now it's time for offense."

item.title: Activists Plan Mass Marijuana Consumption At The White House, But Some Cannabis Advocates Question Civil Disobedience
item.description:
Activists Plan Mass Marijuana Consumption At The White House, But Some Cannabis Advocates Question Civil Disobedience

The idea of marijuana smoke wafting across the White House lawn and snaking around the tall Ionic columns of the iconic Truman Balcony, perhaps even sneaking inside past the gilded furniture and portraits of presidents past, is a tantalizing prospect for organizers of a planned Pennsylvania Avenue demonstration.

item.title: Swapping Meth for Weed: What We Know So Far About the UK's Real-Life Walter White | VICE | United States
item.description:
Swapping Meth for Weed: What We Know So Far About the UK's Real-Life Walter White | VICE | United States

Policemen dealing with another cannabis bust. Photo: West Midlands Police via. This article originally appeared on VICE UK About two years ago, a middle-aged woman from a quiet village became a short-lived tabloid sensation. To outsiders, Susan McKay had been living a bog-standard life as a teacher, mother and co-owner of a local bed and breakfast.

item.title: Medical Marijuana Patients Worry That the State's New Pot Authorization Form Is an Overshare
item.description:
Medical Marijuana Patients Worry That the State's New Pot Authorization Form Is an Overshare

Washington's first official state-sanctioned medical marijuana authorization form isn't sitting well with many medical marijuana patients. At issue is the inclusion of a section requiring patients to list their qualifying condition, something almost universally absent from the ad hoc forms used previously in the unregulated medical marijuana system.

item.title: 'Cannibal' murder triggered by illegal drugs, says health watchdog
item.description:
'Cannibal' murder triggered by illegal drugs, says health watchdog

The murder of a young woman in an apparent cannibal attack by a recently released prisoner was likely to have been triggered by a severe reaction to illegal drugs, a health watchdog has found.

item.title: Painkiller fentanyl linked to six deaths and numerous overdoses in Sacramento area
item.description:
Painkiller fentanyl linked to six deaths and numerous overdoses in Sacramento area

Fentanyl, a powerful painkiller that can be fatal even in small doses, is the latest front in a nationwide epidemic of street drug abuse, recently becoming the prime suspect in a rash of overdoses that killed six people in less than a week in Sacramento County.

item.title: Drug supply chain run from remote caravan site - BBC News
item.description:
Drug supply chain run from remote caravan site - BBC News

A couple have been jailed for masterminding a Â£1.5m drugs operation from two caravans in rural Somerset. Cannabis, heroin, amphetamines, scales and gloves were recovered from the secluded campsite in Priddy in a police operation last July. Richard and Ann Miles, of Brislington, Bristol were jailed for 11 and 12 years respectively.
